snippet.textDisplay:
As long as the controller itself will be similar in terms of size to DS4 I'll be happy. Despite my relatively long fingers the DS4 just felt better for me than Xbox controllers.
In terms of design I can't really be mad at Sony, I love their minimalistic designs.
snippet.textOriginal:
As long as the controller itself will be similar in terms of size to DS4 I'll be happy. Despite my relatively long fingers the DS4 just felt better for me than Xbox controllers.

snippet.textDisplay: Maybe it will finally replace the ds3 controllers for me but I have some doubts.. The edges around the backtriggers might get uncomfortable after a while and it has the same shitty trigger design as the ds4. I vastly prefer the convex soft rubber triggers of the ds3. And the rough surface on the back triggers isn't back either.. I might have to stockpile some more ds3 controllers for the future if this one feels as bad as I fear it might
snippet.textOriginal: Maybe it will finally replace the ds3 controllers for me but I have some doubts.. The edges around the backtriggers might get uncomfortable after a while and it has the same shitty trigger design as the ds4. I vastly prefer the convex soft rubber triggers of the ds3. And the rough surface on the back triggers isn't back either.. I might have to stockpile some more ds3 controllers for the future if this one feels as bad as I fear it might

snippet.textDisplay:
I really like this, And after a few looks i kindof imagine this thing hunted and shot a 360 controller and is now wearing its pelt as a trophy.

Which honestly is exactly how the two companies are interacting right now XD
Admittedly I used to be a bit of an Xbox puritan but between the disaster that was the Xbox 1 against the more sensible and better thought out PS4 I've definitely opened up to playstation consoles. This one is gonna be a good one for sure

That would be even more amazing.!!
@.!!!

snippet.textDisplay: Get rid of the damn touch pad and give back start and select. I really didnt like the analogue sticks on ps4's controller there wasnt enugh movement for your thumbs and often made my thumbs sore, the 5's dont look any different. Finally I hope its better made and not as likely for the buttons and sticks to get fucked up, my right shoulder buttons on each controller often register inputs when trying to use the touch pad, options, X button & R3.
snippet.textOriginal: Get rid of the damn touch pad and give back start and select. I really didnt like the analogue sticks on ps4's controller there wasnt enugh movement for your thumbs and often made my thumbs sore, the 5's dont look any different. Finally I hope its better made and not as likely for the buttons and sticks to get fucked up, my right shoulder buttons on each controller often register inputs when trying to use the touch pad, options, X button & R3.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly I prefer Controllers that take AA Batteries. I have rechargable AA Batteries and it's actually very nice to just be able to swap batteries in 10 seconds and be on a full charge again instead of having to play wired while its charging. I also don't have to worry about my internal battey wearing out and dying. Sony  might have thought about this,but it could also be a real struggle or or impossible to replace the battery on this dualsense controller without damaging it (like Stadia) and I'm not a huge fan of what could be described as planned obsolescense.
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly I prefer Controllers that take AA Batteries. I have rechargable AA Batteries and it's actually very nice to just be able to swap batteries in 10 seconds and be on a full charge again instead of having to play wired while its charging. I also don't have to worry about my internal battey wearing out and dying. Sony  might have thought about this,but it could also be a real struggle or or impossible to replace the battery on this dualsense controller without damaging it (like Stadia) and I'm not a huge fan of what could be described as planned obsolescense.

snippet.textDisplay:
It finally looks good. People were enarmoured with the old one just because they were used to it. It's still always listed as the go to controller for fighting games (other than arcade sticks ofc) despite being absolute ass. The D-Pad is the stuff of nightmares and the triggers will cut into your flesh once you'll have to grip it tighter.
And even on casual play I absolutely hate it. Don't get me started on how many heart attacks I had in Bloodborne, just because I triggered R2 just by putting the controller aside.
snippet.textOriginal:
It finally looks good. People were enarmoured with the old one just because they were used to it. It's still always listed as the go to controller for fighting games (other than arcade sticks ofc) despite being absolute ass. The D-Pad is the stuff of nightmares and the triggers will cut into your flesh once you'll have to grip it tighter.
And even on casual play I absolutely hate it. Don't get me started on how many heart attacks I had in Bloodborne, just because I triggered R2 just by putting the controller aside.

snippet.textDisplay:
It looks just like the old controller.... Honestly the only real difference is the color. So... . why?
Also, haptic feedback is stupid. The first thing I do when I get a new controller is take out the silly motors they stick in there to vibrate stuff.
I don't want my controller wiggling around while i'm playing. That's my job.
And pulling a string on a bow feels NOTHING like the wiggling around of a controller. Go pull a bow sometime Yong! (Right after you stock up on toilet paper)
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: The most important thing for me in a controller is how comfortable it is to hold in your hand. I think the XBox One is the best controller because it feels sturdy and comfortable. I don't care about a built in speaker and microphone or haptic feed back. I honestly wish they would remove some of the battery intensive features like the microphone and the lights. The PS4 controller was a big improvement over the PS3 one though. The Dualshock 4 is a great controller. Hope the Dual Sense feels just as good. Really hope it feels better.
snippet.textOriginal: The most important thing for me in a controller is how comfortable it is to hold in your hand. I think the XBox One is the best controller because it feels sturdy and comfortable. I don't care about a built in speaker and microphone or haptic feed back. I honestly wish they would remove some of the battery intensive features like the microphone and the lights. The PS4 controller was a big improvement over the PS3 one though. The Dualshock 4 is a great controller. Hope the Dual Sense feels just as good. Really hope it feels better.

snippet.textDisplay: As long as I can disable haptic feedback and the mic I'm fine. On dualshock 4 I disabled the speaker and vibrations. The controller should only input the players actions. All output should come from the screen and audio equipment.

snippet.textDisplay: Tbh I don't see why the design is getting so much flack. I think it looks really good
snippet.textOriginal: Tbh I don't see why the design is getting so much flack. I think it looks really good

snippet.textDisplay:
It looks great. Seriously amazing design. It's a big step forward while staying true to what it always has been. Black is better because you don't see it as much in your peripheral.

On a side note I think it's hilarious how triggered the xbox fanboys are about it. It's insane the level of hate they're throwing at it. Trying to claim it copies xbox's design? I've read hundreds of comments like this while the truth is the complete polar opposite. If you look at the very first original 'gigantic' xbox controller and compare it to the original PlayStation controller you can clearly see who is copying who.. The original xbox controller's shape looks nothing like the original. The PS5 controller on the other hand has retained most of it's overall shape only changing the curves of it's surface to be more comfortable in the hands.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Literally all I care about is that it feels like a PS controller in my hand. PS dualshock controllers were always the most comfortable for me, so I'm disappointed out the get go if it sits differently in my hand. Also, I think this controller looks dumb. As long as it doesn't feel like an Xbox controller it'll still be the better option for my hands. Probably. Looks better on side angle. Hate the white.

snippet.textDisplay: More worthless gimmicks that just jack the cost up.  These fucking things are almost as much as the consoles.
snippet.textOriginal: More worthless gimmicks that just jack the cost up.  These fucking things are almost as much as the consoles.

snippet.textDisplay: Another novelty. Im a sony guy but no game is going to use this feature unless its a play station exclusive. For the same reason not many games at all used the the touch pad on ps4 or the motion controls of the ps4 remember those.... u could use them on gta i think to steer. Or even worse the abserdly loud speaker in the controller that only like 3 games took advantage of anoyingly. It was always a phone call that didnt make since because they would speak from ur controller but your character would speak from the tv.... u would think if im speaking into the phone itd be the same volume to me as them speaking to me but eh. Theyre just silly little things no one asked for and theyre running up the price of the console for no reason. Dont get me wrong if they drastically changed the way games are played it would be neat but that would never happen. Simply because other consoles might not use the same form of movement or sense so its better to just make a game for the average controller

snippet.textDisplay: I’m looking back and forth from that controller and my Xbox controller to my side. Basically looks like PS reduced the curvature of the left and right “shoulders” to the grips and lengthened somewhat the “legs” of the grips. Along with swapping the locations of the buttons/Dpad to allow for avoiding legal copyright issues. Love that built in battery making me have to buy new controllers every time a battery fails and/or charge inefficiencies begin (sarcasm).
snippet.textOriginal: I’m looking back and forth from that controller and my Xbox controller to my side. snippet.textDisplay: I have a very unpopular opinion. I really did not care for dualshock 4. Its bot that i thought it was bad, but it was just not for me. I play primarily fighting games and I used to play on pad. I switched to stick this gen partially because it was the first time i could afford a decent stick but also because the d-pad on dualshock 4 was a pain. I remember doing run cancel combos in mkx and blistering my thumb which had never happened before in any other game. The d-pad also did not register motions properly in a consistent way. Idk all the details because this was discovered after i stopped using ds4 but i guess diagonals did not always work correctly which is REALLY bad for that type of game. The d pad here looks similar which is concerning but i also understand that most games being played are not like fighters and everything else looks good so still hype just cautiously so. (Also im probably gonna just use some third party controller anyway because normal controllers now feel weird to me)
snippet.textOriginal: I have a very unpopular opinion. I really did not care for dualshock 4. Its bot that i thought it was bad, but it was just not for me. I play primarily fighting games and I used to play on pad. I switched to stick this gen partially because it was the first time i could afford a decent stick but also because the d-pad on dualshock 4 was a pain. I remember doing run cancel combos in mkx and blistering my thumb which had never happened before in any other game. The d-pad also did not register motions properly in a consistent way. Idk all the details because this was discovered after i stopped using ds4 but i guess diagonals did not always work correctly which is REALLY bad for that type of game. The d pad here looks similar which is concerning but i also understand that most games being played are not like fighters and everything else looks good so still hype just cautiously so. (Also im probably gonna just use some third party controller anyway because normal controllers now feel weird to me)

snippet.textDisplay:
haptic feedback... that's being promoted as a feature? like it's new? I know I've been playing Xbox and that's been standard for what the inception of it?

I even had to look it up to see if indeed they were trying to shoot for "true" haptic feedback and if there's a distinguishing Factor, and yea, it's been an Xbox thing for a very very very long time.... I have psx ps2 ps3 and ps4 pro 4 gaming pcs, and all the xbox's along with having 3 or 4 Xbox ones... so no not a fan boy. just found that comical guess I never cared to notice
